title: Between the backslapping, John Humphrys's final Today never let us forget what an important, fearless journalist he is
text:
"I just come in quietly expecting a nice quiet morning,” said John Humphrys, the BBC’s most famously grumpy journalist, on his last morning presenting the Today programme on Radio 4 after 32 years. “And these other people come in and start making trouble…”

With jokes like that, Humphrys’s final time in the Today chair was, basically, an affectionate three-hour retirement party. His co-presenter, Justin Webb, played clips of some of Humphrys’s best bits. BBC Director General Lord Hall dropped into the studio to pay tribute alongside co-presenters old and new, including Sue MacGregor, who had been Humphrys’s first co-host in 1987 and helped him to get the hang of the job.
